project.resource: Notes about ALSA framework's packages maintenance

body.p: It's not uncommon that a package is part of sound herd but have a direct maintainer. To avoid misunderstanding, such packages are to be considered maintained by that developer, leaving the herd as a fallback for when the maintainer is away for too much time. Always try to get a hold of the direct maintainer before touching a package that has a direct maintainer.

Sound software, in particular libraries, is usually fragile, often tailored on a specific version of a given library. For this reason, be very careful when bumping a package, especially libraries, and always look to the ChangeLog to spot possible API changes that might break programs.
Examples of libraries that are fragile with version changes are libcddb (that used to export transparent types changed to opaque, breaking vlc build), libnjb and tunepimp.
body.warn: Don't ever trust the change in version number to assest the extension of changes in API and ABI, many libraries changes API with minor version change, some also with micro version changes.
